intro: Passerina telonensis, commonly known as the Telonensis pasqueflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related genera. The plant is characterized by its early spring blooming habit, with showy, cup-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and often covered with fine hairs. Passerina telonensis thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments.
